channel.title: Self-Supervised Learning on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in Self-Supervised Learning on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: A probability contrastive learning framework for 3D molecular representation learning
item.description: A novel probability-based contrastive learning framework significantly improves 3D molecular representation learning by mitigating false pairs, achieving state-of-the-art results.

item.title: Abstracted Shapes as Tokens - A Generalizable and Interpretable Model for Time-series Classification
item.description: VQShape: a pre-trained model uses abstracted shapes as interpretable tokens for generalizable time-series classification, achieving comparable performance to black-box models and excelling in zero-sho…

item.title: Accelerating Augmentation Invariance Pretraining
item.description: Boost Vision Transformer pretraining speed by 4x with novel sequence compression techniques!

item.title: Addressing Spatial-Temporal Heterogeneity: General Mixed Time Series Analysis via Latent Continuity Recovery and Alignment
item.description: MiTSformer, a novel framework, recovers latent continuous variables from discrete data to enable complete spatial-temporal modeling of mixed time series, achieving state-of-the-art performance on mult…

item.title: Brain-JEPA: Brain Dynamics Foundation Model with Gradient Positioning and Spatiotemporal Masking
item.description: Brain-JEPA: a novel brain dynamics foundation model leverages fMRI data via innovative gradient positioning and spatiotemporal masking to achieve state-of-the-art performance in diverse brain activity…

item.title: Causal Contrastive Learning for Counterfactual Regression Over Time
item.description: Causal CPC: a novel method for accurate and efficient counterfactual regression over time using RNNs, CPC, and InfoMax, achieving state-of-the-art performance.

item.title: Cell ontology guided transcriptome foundation model
item.description: scCello: A Cell Ontology-Guided Transcriptome Foundation Model improves single-cell RNA sequencing analysis by incorporating cell lineage information, significantly boosting accuracy and generalizabil…

item.title: Connecting Joint-Embedding Predictive Architecture with Contrastive Self-supervised Learning
item.description: C-JEPA boosts self-supervised visual learning by integrating contrastive learning with a joint-embedding predictive architecture, enhancing stability and representation quality.

item.title: Contrastive-Equivariant Self-Supervised Learning Improves Alignment with Primate Visual Area IT
item.description: Self-supervised learning models can now better predict primate IT neural responses by preserving structured variability to input transformations, improving alignment with biological visual perception.

item.title: Data-Efficient Operator Learning via Unsupervised Pretraining and In-Context Learning
item.description: Data-efficient neural operator learning is achieved via unsupervised pretraining and in-context learning, significantly reducing simulation costs and improving generalization.

item.title: EEGPT: Pretrained Transformer for Universal and Reliable Representation of EEG Signals
item.description: EEGPT: A pretrained transformer model revolutionizes EEG signal representation by using a dual self-supervised learning method, achieving state-of-the-art results across various tasks.

item.title: Efficiency for Free: Ideal Data Are Transportable Representations
item.description: RELA accelerates representation learning by leveraging freely available pre-trained models to generate efficient data, reducing computational costs by up to 50% while maintaining accuracy.

item.title: Efficient Availability Attacks against Supervised and Contrastive Learning Simultaneously
item.description: New attacks foil both supervised and contrastive learning, achieving state-of-the-art unlearnability with less computation.

item.title: Exploitation of a Latent Mechanism in Graph Contrastive Learning: Representation Scattering
item.description: SGRL, a novel graph contrastive learning framework, significantly boosts performance by leveraging the inherent ‘representation scattering’ mechanism and integrating graph topology, outperforming exis…

item.title: Exploiting Representation Curvature for Boundary Detection in Time Series
item.description: RECURVE: A novel boundary detection method leveraging representation trajectory curvature, surpassing state-of-the-art techniques by accommodating both gradual and abrupt changes in time series.

item.title: Exploring Molecular Pretraining Model at Scale
item.description: Uni-Mol2, a groundbreaking 1.1B parameter molecular pretraining model, reveals power-law scaling in molecular representation learning, achieving significant performance improvements on downstream task…

item.title: Flexible mapping of abstract domains by grid cells via self-supervised extraction and projection of generalized velocity signals
item.description: Brain’s flexible mapping of abstract domains is achieved via self-supervised extraction and projection of generalized velocity signals by grid cells, enabling efficient map generation.

item.title: FUG: Feature-Universal Graph Contrastive Pre-training for Graphs with Diverse Node Features
item.description: FUG: A new graph contrastive pre-training strategy solves GNN transferability issues across datasets with diverse node features, achieving comparable performance to retraining while significantly impr…

item.title: Harnessing small projectors and multiple views for efficient vision pretraining
item.description: Boost self-supervised visual learning: This paper introduces theoretical insights and practical recommendations to significantly improve SSL’s efficiency and reduce data needs.

item.title: Identify Then Recommend: Towards Unsupervised Group Recommendation
item.description: Unsupervised group recommendation model, ITR, achieves superior user and group recommendation accuracy by dynamically identifying user groups and employing self-supervised learning, eliminating the ne…

item.title: In-Context Symmetries: Self-Supervised Learning through Contextual World Models
item.description: CONTEXTSSL: A novel self-supervised learning algorithm that adapts to task-specific symmetries by using context, achieving significant performance gains over existing methods.

item.title: Large Pre-trained time series models for cross-domain Time series analysis tasks
item.description: Large Pre-trained Time-series Models (LPTM) achieves superior forecasting and time-series classification results using a novel adaptive segmentation method, requiring up to 40% less data and 50% less …

item.title: Learning predictable and robust neural representations by straightening image sequences
item.description: Self-supervised learning gets a boost: New objective function trains robust & predictive neural networks by straightening video trajectories, surpassing invariance methods for better spatiotemporal re…

item.title: Localizing Memorization in SSL Vision Encoders
item.description: SSL vision encoders, while trained on massive datasets, surprisingly memorize individual data points. This paper introduces novel methods to precisely pinpoint this memorization within encoders at bot…

item.title: MSA Generation with Seqs2Seqs Pretraining: Advancing Protein Structure Predictions
item.description: Self-supervised generative model MSA-Generator boosts protein structure prediction accuracy by producing high-quality MSAs, especially for challenging sequences lacking homologs.

item.title: Multiple Physics Pretraining for Spatiotemporal Surrogate Models
item.description: Multiple Physics Pretraining (MPP) revolutionizes spatiotemporal physical surrogate modeling by pretraining transformers on diverse physics simultaneously, enabling accurate predictions on unseen syst…

item.title: Online Feature Updates Improve Online (Generalized) Label Shift Adaptation
item.description: Online Label Shift adaptation with Online Feature Updates (OLS-OFU) significantly boosts online label shift adaptation by dynamically refining feature extractors using self-supervised learning, achiev…

item.title: Preventing Dimensional Collapse in Self-Supervised Learning via Orthogonality Regularization
item.description: Orthogonal regularization prevents dimensional collapse in self-supervised learning, significantly boosting model performance across diverse benchmarks.

item.title: Protected Test-Time Adaptation via Online Entropy Matching: A Betting Approach
item.description: POEM: a novel test-time adaptation approach using online self-training improves accuracy under distribution shifts by dynamically updating the classifier, ensuring invariance to shifts while maintaini…

item.title: Resource-Aware Federated Self-Supervised Learning with Global Class Representations
item.description: FedMKD: A multi-teacher framework for federated self-supervised learning, enabling global class representations even with diverse client models and skewed data distributions.

item.title: Revisiting Self-Supervised Heterogeneous Graph Learning from Spectral Clustering Perspective
item.description: SCHOOL: A novel SHGL framework enhancing spectral clustering with rank and dual consistency constraints, effectively mitigating noise and leveraging cluster-level information for improved downstream t…

item.title: Self-Guided Masked Autoencoder
item.description: Self-guided MAE boosts self-supervised learning by intelligently masking image patches based on internal clustering patterns, dramatically accelerating training without external data.

item.title: Self-Healing Machine Learning: A Framework for Autonomous Adaptation in Real-World Environments
item.description: Self-healing machine learning (SHML) autonomously diagnoses and fixes model performance degradation caused by data shifts, outperforming reason-agnostic methods.

item.title: Self-Labeling the Job Shop Scheduling Problem
item.description: Self-Labeling Improves Generative Model Training for Combinatorial Problems

item.title: Self-Supervised Adversarial Training via Diverse Augmented Queries and Self-Supervised Double Perturbation
item.description: DAQ-SDP enhances self-supervised adversarial training by using diverse augmented queries, a self-supervised double perturbation scheme, and a novel Aug-Adv Pairwise-BatchNorm method, bridging the gap …

item.title: Self-supervised Transformation Learning for Equivariant Representations
item.description: Self-Supervised Transformation Learning (STL) enhances equivariant representations by replacing transformation labels with image-pair-derived representations, improving performance on diverse classifi…

item.title: The Benefits of Balance: From Information Projections to Variance Reduction
item.description: Data balancing in foundation models surprisingly reduces variance, improving model training and performance.

item.title: Towards a 'Universal Translator' for Neural Dynamics at Single-Cell, Single-Spike Resolution
item.description: A new self-supervised learning approach, Multi-task Masking (MtM), significantly improves the prediction accuracy of neural population activity by capturing neural dynamics at multiple spatial scales,…

item.title: Uncovering the Redundancy in Graph Self-supervised Learning Models
item.description: Graph self-supervised learning models surprisingly exhibit high redundancy, allowing for significant parameter reduction without performance loss. A novel framework, SLIDE, leverages this discovery f…

item.title: Understanding the Role of Equivariance in Self-supervised Learning
item.description: E-SSL’s generalization ability is rigorously analyzed via an information-theoretic lens, revealing key design principles for improved performance.

item.title: Unified Graph Augmentations for Generalized Contrastive Learning on Graphs
item.description: Unified Graph Augmentations (UGA) module boosts graph contrastive learning by unifying diverse augmentation strategies, improving model generalizability and efficiency.

item.title: You Don’t Need Domain-Specific Data Augmentations When Scaling Self-Supervised Learning
item.description: Self-supervised learning’s reliance on complex data augmentations is challenged; a large-scale study shows comparable performance using only cropping, suggesting dataset size is more important than au…

item.title: Your contrastive learning problem is secretly a distribution alignment problem
item.description: Contrastive learning is reframed as a distribution alignment problem, leading to a flexible framework (GCA) that improves representation learning with unbalanced optimal transport.

item.title: Your Diffusion Model is Secretly a Noise Classifier and Benefits from Contrastive Training
item.description: Diffusion models benefit from contrastive training, improving sample quality and speed by addressing poor denoiser estimation in out-of-distribution regions.
